reviews.text: We got a room with a great view of the roof and the generater... We kept the room for two days before we decided to ask for a new room. The message was that we have booked a standard room and all the standard rooms have crappy views. We could switch to a room looking into a trashbin. The extra cost for a seaview room was only 18 euros extra per night so we choose that. We got a great room overlooking the sea and pool plus we had a huge balcony.

reviews.text: We booked this aparthotel on the strength of the favourable reviews on this site. After a five night stay there, we cannot see what all the fuss is about, if ever a place was over - hyped it is this one. This is an average apartment complex which is extremely overpriced. Staff on the reception and in the bar seem to be efficient and personable. The maid working our landing was a miserable old boot who didn't even show any acknowlegement. We paid £400 for the 5 nights and in Palma Nova at the end of October, this is not cheap by any stretch of the imagination. We had a one bedroom apartment with sea view - it was room 602 and it probably has one of the best views in the complex, which was a positive, so if you must stay here, it may be worthwhile asking for this room. You pay extra for the view and we could tell that other rooms would have had a view blocked by the trees. The room was large, but only had one electrical socket hidden behind a sideboard in the living room. The toilet wouldn't flush properley and the walls were very thin, noises and voices carried from both inside the apartment and from on the balconies. The apartment needs updating / upgrading. Whenever the window was open the doors in the apartment rattled incessantly in their frames, even when they were properly closed. It is true what other reviewers have said about the waterproof towels..they have to be experienced to be believed. The safety deposit boxes are in the reception area and this is a major inconvenience, they ought to be in the rooms where you can access them whenever you want to, instead of having to trek down to the lobby. The complex is a fair old walk into Palma Nova (and uphill on the way back) so if you are thinking of staying here you will have to make this trek to get to the 'facilities' of the resort. Most of the other guests seemed to be middle aged and middle class Scandinavians (heaven knows what they were doing in this resort) which , apart from the small area close to where the Ponent Mar is,seems to be frequented by roaming packs of the most downmarket tattooed underclass. There are wall to wall bars showing constant football or the tackiest of the tacky...karaoke. If you really want to see our tourists in all their glory though, take a walk into the neighbouring hell that is Magaluf, because Palma Nova is like St. Tropez in comparison. Won't be back to this grim resort in a hurry and wouldn't stay in Ponent Mar if we did..not because we had any particular problems because we didn't, but I'm sure that there are better (and cheaper) places to stay. Future bookers take note and don't believe the hype about this place, and end up paying through the nose for somewhere distinctly ordinary.
